content:
this is a single endpoint from an open api spec document
it has been minified by removing unnecessary kvps
additionally common terms have been abbreviated  operationId: GetMonitor path: https://gateway.stackpath.com/monitoring/v2/stacks/{stack_id}/monitors/{monitor_id} content: params
name stackid
desc a stack id or slug
in path
required true
schema
type str
name monitorid
desc a monitor id
in path
required true
schema
type str
sum get a monitor
responses
200
v2getmonitorresponse
type obj
v2monitor
type obj
props
id
type str
desc a monitors unique identifier
name
type str
desc the name of a monitor

a monitors name
v2monitorstatus
type str
default unknown
desc the status of a monitor

 unknown unable to determine the status of the service being monitored this is likely due to a new monitor that has not been checked yet
  up the status of the service being monitored is up
  down the status of the service being monitored is down
  slow the status of the service being monitored is slow a service with a slow status means the service is up but responses are taking longer than 500 milliseconds
uptimepercentage
type num
format double
desc the percent of time a monitored service has had a status of up or slow in the last hour
avgresponsetime
type str
desc the average response time for a monitor
locations
type arr

type obj
props
id
type str
desc a locations unique identifier
name
type str
desc a locations name
city
type str
desc a locations city
citycode
type str
desc a locations city expressed as an iata airport code
country
type str
desc a locations country
countrycode
type str
desc a locations iso31661 alpha2 country code
provider
type str
desc a locations network provider
ipaddresses
type str
desc the ip addresses of a location

the ip addresses where monitoring checks originate from
hasipv4
type bool
format bool
desc whether or not a location supports ipv4 monitoring checks
hasipv6
type bool
format bool
desc whether or not a location supports ipv6 monitoring checks
desc a location which performs monitoring checks
desc the locations a service is monitored from
interval
type str
desc the amount of time between each monitor check

by default each service monitor will be checked every five minutes
timeout
type str
desc then length of time to wait until the monitor check times out
v2ipversion
type str
default ipv4
desc the ip version of a monitor

the ip version defines which type of location a monitor can run from  not all locations support both ip versions

  ipv4 an ipv4 monitor
  ipv6 an ipv6 monitor

the url must begin with a case insensitive http scheme of http or https
